event.title: Over 1000 cases of illness have now

data.event: Over 1000 cases of illness have now been identified in a foodborne salmonellosis outbreak that began in mid-April 2008 in the United States.
Over 1000 cases of illness have now been identified in a foodborne salmonellosis outbreak that began in mid-April 2008 in the United States.
Although independent testing of both loads showed no sign of Salmonella, the peppers are still on hold until the FDA finishes its own testing of the second load flagged on July 1st.
"The salability of that produce in two to three days is gone.
You can’t tie jalapeño pepper shipped on June 30 back to April 10."
